Platform.Title: MWG E. coli K12 V2 Array
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: MWG E. coli K12 V2 Array The MWG E. coli Array contains 4,288 gene specific oligonucleotide probes representing the complete E. coli (K12) genome. Specifications: Total number of genes: 4,288 ORFs of E. coli strain K12 covered by 4239 oligos Information sources: NCBI/Genbank NC00913, U00096.1 Strand analyzed: Sense strand Number of slides: 1 Length of probes: 50 mer Number of oligonucleotides per gene:1 Total number of spots: 4,608 Replicated spots: 47 Production control oligos (ara): 48 Spot area: 1.8 x 1.8 cm

Sample.Title: Transcriptional response of E. coli to TPEN (m2)

Channel.Source: E. coli K12 grown in minimal medium with added 5 μM TPEN
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: E. coli K12 grown in minimal medium without added TPEN
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: DNA microarray slides were scanned by using the Genepix® 4000B Microarray scanner. Image analyses of scanned microarrays were performed using GenePix® Pro 5.0. (Axon). Images were visually inspected and spots affected by irregularities were flagged manually. Resulting data were filtered according to the following criteria: (a) removal of flagged spots (b) removal of spots with diameter <70 μm (average spot size on arrays is 120 μm), and (c) removal of spots with (% pixels 532 nm > background + 1 standard deviation) + (% pixels 635 nm > background + 1 standard deviation) < 100. For the remaining values, log2 transformations were applied, and linear normalizations were used to correct the parameter “median of ratios” to median = 0. For each series a two-tailed t-test was performed on the data from one dye combination (e.g. control cDNA were labeled Cy5 and cDNA from the TPEN stressed cells were labeled Cy3) and the corresponding dye-swap experiments (e.g. control cDNA were labeled Cy3 and and cDNA from the TPEN stressed cells were labeled Cy5).

Series.Title: Transcriptional response of E. coli to TPEN
Series.Summary: DNA microarrays were used to probe the transcriptional response of E. coli to N,N,N',N'-tetrakis(2-pyridylmethyl)ethylenediamine (TPEN). Fifty-five transcripts were significantly up-regulated including all of the genes that are regulated by Zur and many genes regulated by Fur. In these same TPEN-treated cells, forty-six transcripts were significantly down-regulated. Keywords: E. coli, TPEN, zinc
Series.Overall-Design: To identify genes that are differentially-expressed in response to TPEN, E. coli BL21(DE3) cells grown in minimal medium until the cultures reached mid-log phase. TPEN was introduced and the cells were cultured for 5 hours; this time was chosen so that the results would correspond to previous transcriptional response studies with excess Zn(II). The cultures containing 5 uM TPEN were analyzed with DNA microarrays (E. coli K12 V2 array slides from MWG-BIOTECH), and the results were compared to those from E. coli cells grown in minimal medium containing no TPEN. A minimum of six slides was used for each experiment (3 slides with one combination of Cy3 and Cy5 dyes and 3 slides with swapped dyes).
